And we have more to come this year and next. Check 'em out! https://www.jec.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/democrats/podcast …

Oh SNAP!!! #OTD in 1977, Jimmy Carter signed the Food Stamp Act, which last year alone benefited 40M people and lifted 3.1M out of poverty.  https://www.jec.senate.gov/public/_cache/files/d657a411-2fd3-4570-b352-ff86ab54aa16/supplemental-nutrition-assistance-program---jec-update-.pdf … pic.twitter.com/0knieWfVsf

And ICYMI, Vice Chair @RepMaloney had this to say yesterday about GDP data: "The President’s tax cuts gave the economy a sugar high that has already faded and resulted in growing budget deficits." https://queenscountypolitics.com/2019/09/27/queens-lawmakers-on-the-move-sept-27-2019/ …

The Atlanta and New York Fed both revised estimates for Q3 GDP today, showing it growing at an underwhelming 2.1%. That would follow 2.0% gains in Q2 and would be a far cry from the 3-6% GDP Trump promised. https://www.cnbc.com/2019/09/26/us-gdp-q2-2019-final.html …

And orders for long-lasting or durable goods rose 0.2% from July, @uscensusbureau just reported. If you exclude defense-related equipment, new orders fell 0.6%. New orders of capital goods excluding defense/aircraft—often seen as an indicator of business investment—fell 0.2%.

JUST IN: Consumer spending slowed more than forecast in August, rising just 0.1% from the prior month. #EconTwitter https://www.marketwatch.com/story/consumer-spending-barely-rises-in-august-as-americans-save-more-2019-09-27 …

On #WorldContraceptionDay it's worth noting that access to birth control brings massive economic benefits. According to one study, availability of birth control pills is responsible for roughly 1/3 of the total wage gains women have made since the 1960s.  https://www.jec.senate.gov/public/_cache/files/bb400414-8dee-4e39-abd3-c2460fd30e7d/the-economic-benefits-of-birth-control-and-access-to-family-planning.pdf …
Increased inequality should come as no surprise, as Republican tax cuts (known as TCJA) implemented in 2018 favored the wealthy. pic.twitter.com/7fvdjPKJDC

NEW: Income inequality was "significantly higher" last year than 2017, @uscensusbureau reported in its American Community Survey. The Gini index (where 0.0 is perfect equality in income distribution and 1.0 indicates total inequality) rose to 0.485. https://www.usatoday.com/story/money/2019/09/26/income-inequality-highest-over-50-years-census-bureau-shows/3772919002/ …

Vice Chair @RepMaloney called today's GDP report "disappointing."

“This number falls far short of the more than 3 percent rate that the President has promised and it’s nowhere near the 6 percent growth that he had predicted two years ago.” https://www.jec.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/democrats/press-releases?ID=0BAAC5FC-1A6E-4AE8-9B0A-76E439519C0B …

Meanwhile the trade deficit in August expanded by 0.5% from the prior month, reaching $72.8 billion, @uscensusbureau reported this morning.  https://www.census.gov/econ/indicators/advance_report.pdf …

The latest GDP estimate has some disappointing changes. It revised down investments and consumer spending, which were offset by increased government outlays & exports. https://www.marketwatch.com/story/second-quarter-us-gdp-left-at-2-downshifting-economy-unlikely-to-rev-up-soon-2019-09-26?mod=hp_minor_pos21 …
BREAKING: GDP grew 2.0% in Q2, according to the third estimate from BEA_News. That's unchanged from their prior estimate for Q2, and down from 3.1% growth in Q1. #EconTwitter

Meanwhile, the economy grew 2.0% last quarter and, according to estimates by the Atlanta #Fed, is expanding just 1.9% in 3Q. That's far shy of the 6% growth rate Trump once said was within reach. pic.twitter.com/SKdTSxDDH8

This bears repeating, since Trump just boasted about a record # of jobs under his watch: "The # of people working has hit a record nearly every month since May 2014." (FWIW, Trump entered office in 2017). https://twitter.com/JECDems/status/1154403601810280450 …

Needless to say the climate crisis will have dire consequences for the economy as well. Check out our analysis on that very topic.
 https://www.jec.senate.gov/public/_cache/files/23f52103-aecc-409a-9b12-71dd0b95bbb2/climate-crisis-chapter.pdf …

A new @UN report warns the climate crisis is severely threatening our oceans. This will be devastating, boosting the strength & frequency of storms and even increasing the proliferation of pathogens. https://www.nytimes.com/2019/09/25/climate/climate-change-oceans-united-nations.html?action=click&module=Top%20Stories&pgtype=Homepage …

According to a JEC report requested by Vice Chair @RepMaloney, half of American households run the risk of losing their standard of living in retirement. And women, black people & Hispanics are at much greater risk of being poor in retirement.  https://www.jec.senate.gov/public/_cache/files/bafb9923-7f9a-40ad-b287-4722b8b979cd/retirement-insecurity-jec.pdf …  https://twitter.com/RepMaloney/status/1176544366346854403 … pic.twitter.com/uDtCDhRl0T

And according to research conducted in part by @ian_goldin, migrants have driven 2/3 of U.S. economic growth since 2011. He shows immigrants are 2-3x more likely to start a company, create a patented innovation or win a Nobel Prize... #MuslimBanHearing https://www.ft.com/content/f1ca7b14-b1d6-11e8-87e0-d84e0d934341 …

On the day of the #MuslimBanHearing, it's worth noting the economic benefits that visitors to our country & immigrants bring. According to a Citi GPS report, "migration is conducive to native and aggregate prosperity, especially over longer time frames."  https://www.oxfordmartin.ox.ac.uk/downloads/reports/2018_OMS_Citi_Migration_GPS.pdf … https://twitter.com/aayoub/status/1176554536321855491 …
In fact, it was the biggest drop in nine months. https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-09-24/consumer-confidence-in-u-s-fell-more-than-forecast-in-september?srnd=premium …

Thought we'd retweet this chart, since President Trump just told the @UN that jobs in the U.S. are being created at a record pace. In fact, the rate of job creation has slowed. https://twitter.com/JECDems/status/1169964121539981313 …

NEW: Consumer confidence fell this month, according to a @Conferenceboard survey, as respondents reported a dimmer view on their present & future circumstances. "At some point this continued uncertainty will begin to diminish consumers’ confidence in the expansion." #EconTwitter https://twitter.com/StockBoardAsset/status/1176497102622461953 …

For more on the economics of paid leave, check out our Podcast on the topic, where Vice Chair @RepMaloney and @EileenAppelbaum from @ceprdc both discuss its advantages. https://www.jec.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/democrats/podcast?ID=8D255C6B-ABD7-435F-8A31-2AD5F0F716CF …

In addition to being the right thing to do, offering paid family leave has vast economic benefits. It allows more people to stay in the labor force and helps bridge the gender wage gap. https://twitter.com/RepMaloney/status/1176238029314383873 …

(3/4) The annual cost of gun violence in New York, @RepMaloney's home state, is $5.6B. That includes lost income and spending, employer costs, police and criminal justice responses and healthcare treatment. The 3 largest states (CA, TX and FL) suffer the largest absolute costs. pic.twitter.com/cpkUh2VpmD

(2/4) The report, which shows the cost by state and draws on data from @GiffordsCourage, highlights two of the fastest-growing areas of gun violence: suicides & firearm deaths of young people. It shows states with high rates of gun ownership have the highest rates of gun suicide.

(1/4) Gun violence takes an incalculable human toll. It also has economic costs. A new JEC report requested by Vice Chair @RepMaloney shows gun violence imposes $229 billion in total annual costs on the U.S., or 1.4% of GDP. #EndGunViolence https://www.jec.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/democrats/press-releases?ID=CFC6C690-6270-4BF2-8F43-2FE98AF19D3E …

SNAP helped lift 3.1M people out of poverty last year and in NY contributed to a 1.6 percentage point drop in the poverty rate from 2016-18, @kayderv reported based on @uscensusbureau data. Many Americans who lost health insurance last year were among the most vulnerable. In fact, the # of children without coverage grew by 425,000 in 2018 to 4.3 million, according to #Census. This largely reflects a decline in public coverage that protects low-income families. https://twitter.com/JECDems/status/1171432176644046850 …

The poverty rate fell by 0.5 percentage point in 2018
to 11.8%, with the rate among black & Hispanic people exceeding whites & Asians. The national supplemental poverty measure rate, arguably a more comprehensive way of measuring poverty, was little changed in 2018 at 13.1%. pic.twitter.com/9MxNQkERIQ

Also, median household income in 2018 was about flat from the prior year at $63,200 after three straight years of increases. The data shows persistent inequalities, with income among white and Asian people far exceeding black and Hispanic income. pic.twitter.com/yuGOYdEx15
Breaking: @uscensusbureau report shows the # of people without health insurance last year rose by 1.9M from 2017.

The August @BLS_gov #JobsReport is out:
•Nonfarm employment + by 130K, including 25K temp hires of Census workers. That’s down from 159K in July.
•Unemployment unchanged @ 3.7%.
•Average hourly earnings up 3.2% from last yr.
•Labor force participation inched up to 63.2%.

Stay tuned for our coverage of this morning's @BLS_gov jobs report for August. One point worth noting: Today's data may reflect a  temporary boost from Census hiring. #JobsDay https://www.wsj.com/articles/watch-fridays-jobs-report-for-signs-of-a-deepening-slowdown-11567675802 …

Older workers are staying in the labor force longer, according to @BLS_gov’s Employment Projections: 2018-2028. This trend occurs as more Americans find it harder to finance their retirement. Former NY Fed chief Bill Dudley has penned a follow-up to his controversial op-ed, The Fed Shouldn't Enable Donald Trump, saying "my intention was to be provocative" and "I was not trying to suggest that the Fed should take sides in the upcoming election."  https://www.bloomberg.com/opinion/articles/2019-09-04/what-i-meant-when-i-said-don-t-enable-trump … https://twitter.com/JECDems/status/1166812864688152583 …

Trump's policies are not having the intended effect of shrinking the trade deficit. The shortfall so far this yr is $374B vs. $346B in the same period of '18. He has renegotiated 1 FTA so far, with South Korea, where our trade deficit in goods is up 33%+. https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/economy/trump-promised-to-shrink-the-trade-deficit-instead-it-exploded/2019/03/05/35d3b1e0-3f8f-11e9-a0d3-1210e58a94cf_story.html …

NEW: The U.S. trade deficit for goods & services in July was $54B, down from $55.5B in June, @uscensusbureau & @BEA_News reported. The shortfall was slightly worse than economists had expected. https://www.marketwatch.com/story/trade-deficit-falls-27-in-july-but-the-gap-is-still-as-large-as-ever-and-unlikely-to-shrink-2019-09-04 …

(3/5) According to @EconomicPolicy, a decline in union membership has contributed to inequality.
